N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 150.1 - Statement of policy

State Regulations

On June 20, 1979, New York State and the Security Supervisors

Unit employees, Council 82, AFSCME, AFL-CIO, signed a collective bargaining
agreement for the period April 1, 1979 through March 31, 1982, covering
employees in the Security Supervisors Negotiating Unit which requires that
employee performance be evaluated in an objective manner based on standards
established by a joint Labor/Management Committee. Monetary compensation, in
the form of a performance advancement payment and/or a performance/longevity
payment shall be available to eligible employees in the unit dependent upon the
employee's performance rating. The purpose of such performance evaluation is to
motivate all employees toward more effective performance and greater
productivity by the provision of advancements and/or performance/longevity
payments to eligible employees and by periodic job evaluation for
others. Notes
